content: Career Asked by AnonymousAsked on 29 Aug 2019Seeking career advice in the data analytics sector?I am a recent graduate from NUS and I am thinking of getting a job in the data analytics sector. As I do not have enough skills and experience, what can I do to get into the sector?2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Eric LohLevel 2. RookieUpdated on 03 Sep 2019Take up another job first and in the meantime, do a part-time degree course (financed by the job) on data analytics if you like. There are also a lot of paid/free online courses out there for you to learn technical skills for data analytics (perhaps you can try Udemy which offers online courses at affordable prices) then look for the opportunity to switch your career or apply for an internal transfer in the same company to the relevant department once you have mastered the necessary skills.1 comment1
AAlexander03 Sep 2019Sounds like a great idea! Thank you very much :)

Gabriel Tham, Tag Team Member at Kenichi Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardUpdated on 29 Aug 2019What is your major now?You can try a graduate diploma in data analytics if your major is not in data analytics.If not, try applying for a junior position as a start.2 comments0

AAlexander29 Aug 2019Industrial and Systems EngineeringGabriel Tham29 Aug 2019You can try the Professional conversion programme by skillsfuture
